alert.note: Alert for Pacific (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 6:24AM PST until January 07 at 7:08PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington...Oregon... Grays River near Rosburg affecting Wahkiakum County. Nehalem River near Foss affecting Tillamook and Clatsop Counties. Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. Naselle River near Naselle affecting Pacific and Wahkiakum Counties. Willapa River near Willapa affecting Pacific County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Willapa River near Willapa. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Above 24.0 feet, expect major flooding. Historically, numerous homes and the Willapa Hatchery at Fork Creek have been completely flooded at this point, along with major flooding of numerous roads from Frances downstream to Raymond, including State Route 6 and US Hwy 101. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Thursday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 23.8 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM PST.
